text: Lycée Franco-Péruvien (Francopé;"MOT DU PROVISEUR." Lycée Franco-Péruvien. Retrieved on 16 March 2015. ) is a French international school in Monterrico,"Historia." Lycée Franco-Péruvien. Retrieved on 7 May 2015. Lima, Peru."Plan d'acès au Lycée." Lycée Franco-Péruvien. Retrieved on 16 March 2015. "Av. Morro Solar 550" It serves levels maternelle (preschool) through lycée (senior high school)."Plan du site." Lycée Franco-Péruvien. Retrieved on 16 March 2015. It was first established as École Nouvelle/Escuela Nueva in Miraflores in 1950. On August 30, 1959 André Malraux, the French Minister of Culture, laid the headstone of the school's new building. It moved to its current site in 1960. ==See also== * France–Peru relations ==References== ==External links== * Lycée Franco-Péruvien * Lycée Franco-Péruvien Category:French international schools in South America Category:International schools in Lima Category:Private schools in Peru Category:1950 establishments in Peru Category:Educational institutions established in 1950
title: Lycée Franco-Péruvien
